intro: Ambrosia absynthyfolia, commonly known as the desert ragweed, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is an annual herb that typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, featuring hairy stems and serrated leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in loose panicles, which bloom in the late summer and early fall. It is known for its allergenic pollen, which can contribute to seasonal allergies in humans. Ambrosia absynthyfolia thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and along roadsides.
